Required Sales (units) = (Fixed Cost + Desired Profit) / Contribution per unit

= (1,50,000 + 90,000) / 150 = 1,600 buckets

Answer: (D) 1600 buckets

Question 17
What is the amount of net cash from operating activities of A Ltd. if it has net profit before tax ₹5,90,000; Depreciation on Property, Plant and Equipment ₹4,30,000; Decrease in Current Assets ₹30,000; Decrease in Current Liabilities ₹85,000; and Tax Paid ₹80,000.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.₹9,65,000
  • B.₹8,85,000
  • C.₹10,75,000
  • D.₹9,95,000
Correct Answer: ₹8,85,000

Given:

 

Net profit before tax = ₹5,90,000 (This is the accounting profit — it includes non-cash and accrual items, so we adjust it to arrive at cash from operations.)

 

Add Depreciation = ₹4,30,000 (Depreciation is a non-cash expense — it reduces profit in the Profit & Loss account but does not involve any cash outflow. Hence, it is added back._

 

Add Decrease in Current Assets = ₹30,000 (A decrease in current assets (like debtors, inventory, etc.) means cash has been released or realized from these assets. Therefore, it increases cash flow and is added.

 

Less Decrease in Current Liabilities = ₹85,000 (A decrease in current liabilities (like creditors, outstanding expenses) means the firm has paid off some of its obligations. This results in a cash outflow, so it is subtracted.

 

Less Tax Paid = ₹80,000 (Tax paid is an actual cash outflow, even though it is not part of operating profit computation. Hence, it is deducted to arrive at net cash from operating activities.)

 

Net Cash Flow = 5,90,000 + 4,30,000 + 30,000 – 85,000 – 80,000 = ₹8,85,000

 

✅ Answer: (B) ₹8,85,000

Question 18
The working of current Purchasing Power Accounting requires classification of balance sheet items into Monetary Items and Non-Monetary Items. Which of the following is a Non-Monetary Item as per current Purchasing Power Accounting?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Cash
  • B.Debentures
  • C.Debtors
  • D.Inventories
Correct Answer: Inventories

The Current Purchasing Power (CPP) Method, also called General Price-Level Accounting, adjusts financial statements for inflation. It converts historical costs into values that reflect the current purchasing power of money, using a price index such as the Consumer Price Index (CPI) or Wholesale Price Index (WPI).

 

Under this method, all balance sheet items are divided into two groups — Monetary and Non-Monetary items.

 

1️⃣ Monetary Items: These are assets or liabilities that are fixed in terms of money. Their value does not change with inflation or deflation because the amount to be received or paid is predetermined.

 

Examples of Monetary Assets: Cash, Bank balances, Bills receivable, Debtors, Prepaid expenses,

Account receivables, Investment in bonds or debentures, Accrued income etc.

 

Examples of Monetary Liabilities: Creditors, Accounts payable, Bills payable, Outstanding expenses, Notes payable, Dividend payable, Tax payable, Debentures or bonds, Loan, Advance income, Preference share capital

 

Since these items have fixed monetary value, they are not adjusted for price level changes under the CPP method.

 

2️⃣ Non-Monetary Items: These are assets or liabilities that cannot be stated in fixed monetary terms. Their values fluctuate with the general price level, so they are adjusted using a price index to express them in current purchasing power.

 

Examples of Non-Monetary Items: Land, Building, Machinery, Vehicles, Furniture, Inventory (Stock), Equity share capital, Irredeemable preference share capital, Accumulated depreciation

 

Since Inventories (stock) represent goods whose value changes with inflation, they are non-monetary items and must be restated using the current price index.

 

Thus, in Current Purchasing Power Accounting, monetary items remain unchanged, while non-monetary items like Inventories are adjusted to reflect the change in purchasing power.

Question 19
Match the List–I with List–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)List–IA. Ind AS 2B. Ind AS 16C. Ind AS 103D. Ind AS 113List–III. Property, Plant and EquipmentII. Fair Value MeasurementIII. InventoriesIV. Business CombinationsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
  • B.A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I
  • C.A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II
  • D.A–III, B–I, C–II, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–III, B–I, C–IV, D–II

The correct match is as follows:

 

Ind AS 2 → Inventories (deals with valuation of stock and cost determination).

 

Ind AS 16 → Property, Plant and Equipment (covers recognition, measurement, depreciation).

 

Ind AS 103 → Business Combinations (prescribes accounting for mergers and acquisitions).

 

Ind AS 113 → Fair Value Measurement (provides a single framework for measuring fair value).

Question 20
Which of the following types of audit report are termed together as modified reports as per standards on Auditing (SA) 705?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Qualified ReportB. Audit Report with an ‘Emphasis of Matter’ paragraphC. Disclaimer of opinion ReportD. Adverse ReportChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.A, B and C Only
  • C.B and C Only
  • D.A, C and D Only
Correct Answer: A, C and D Only

Modified reports are issued when the auditor concludes that financial statements are not free from material misstatement or sufficient audit evidence is not obtained.

 

Standards on Auditing (SA) 705 provides guidance on the auditor's responsibility to issue a modified opinion in the independent auditor's report when a modification is necessary due to a material misstatement in the financial statements or an inability to obtain sufficient appropriate audit evidence. The standard specifies the three types of modified opinions—qualified, adverse, and disclaimer—and dictates the form and content of the audit report in such cases

✅ Answer: option (D) A, C and D Only

Question 21
Which of the following statement is incorrect for Management Audit?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Management audit is a statutory requirement.
  • B.Management audit is a comprehensive and critical review of all aspects of management process.
  • C.Management audit covers wide area of management activities and may be for more than one financial year.
  • D.The shareholders or board of directors may appoint the management auditor.
Correct Answer: Management audit is a statutory requirement.

Management Audit is not statutory; it is voluntary and conducted to evaluate the efficiency, effectiveness, and adequacy of management decisions and processes.

 

It is a comprehensive and critical review of all areas of management functioning — planning, organizing, directing, controlling, etc.

 

It may cover multiple financial years and management auditor is usually appointed by the shareholders or board of directors.

Question 22
The cross price elasticity between two goods ‘A’ and ‘B’ is (–) 0.8. If the price of good ‘B’ rise by 20%, how will the demand for ‘A’ change?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.(-) 16%
  • B.6%
  • C.(-) 8%
  • D.(-) 12%
Correct Answer: (-) 16%

Given:

Cross elasticity = –0.8 (negative → goods are complements)

Price of good B ↑ by 20%

Change in demand for A = Cross elasticity × % change in price of B

= (–0.8) × 20 = –16%

Answer: (A) (–) 16%

Question 23
The price of a product decreases from ₹100 to ₹60 per unit. If the price elasticity of demand is 1.5 and the original quantity demanded is 30 units, what will be the new quantity demanded?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.38
  • B.48
  • C.56
  • D.62
Correct Answer: 48

Given:

Price ↓ from ₹100 → ₹60

Elasticity (Ed) = 1.5

Original quantity = 30 units

Formula:

Percentage change in quantity demanded=Ed×Percentage change in pricePercentage change in price=(60-100)100×100=-40%

So,

Change in Quantity=1.5×40=60% increase

New Quantity = 30 + 60% of 30 = 30 + 18 = 48 units

Answer: Option (B) 48

Question 24
The type of market where few sellers are selling competing products to many buyers is known as:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Monopoly
  • B.Monopolistic Competition
  • C.Oligopoly
  • D.Perfect Competition
Correct Answer: Oligopoly

The correct answer is option (C).

 

Oligopoly: Market with few large sellers and many buyers. Each seller’s action affects others (e.g., automobile, telecom).

 

Monopoly: Single seller.

 

Monopolistic Competition: Many sellers with differentiated products.

 

Perfect Competition: Many sellers, identical products.

Question 25
Which of the following formula correctly show the relationship between Average Revenue (AR), Marginal Revenue (MR) and Price elasticity of demand?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.MR=AR+e-1
  • B.AR=MR×e-1e
  • C.MR=AR×e-1e
  • D.MR=AR+e-1e+1
Correct Answer: MR=AR×e-1e

The formula showing the relationship between Average Revenue (AR), Marginal Revenue (MR) and Price elasticity of demand (e) is AR × (1 - 1e )

K (K, L)II.TPn-TPn-1III. Total Product / No. of units of variable factorIV. Q = f (a, b, c, …n)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
  • B.A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III
  • C.A–I, B–II, C–IV, D–III
  • D.A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I
Correct Answer: A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I

The correct answer is A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I.

Question 27
Match the List–I with List–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)List–I (Concept)A. Total UtilityB. Marginal UtilityC. Average Fixed CostD. Marginal CostList–II (Formula)I.MU₁+MU₂+…+MUnII.TUn-TUn-1III.ΔTC/ΔQIV.TFC/QChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I
  • B.A–II, B–I, C–III, D–IV
  • C.A–I, B–II, C–IV, D–III
  • D.A–III, B–II, C–I, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–I, B–II, C–IV, D–III

Question 28
Arrange the following examples of business cycles in chronological order (Old to New):(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Dot Com bubble burstB. Great DepressionC. Covid PandemicD. Global Financial CrisisChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, A, D, C
  • C.D, B, A, C
  • D.C, D, A, B
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C

To arrange the given business cycle events in chronological order (oldest to newest):

 

Event

Year / Period

Description

B. Great Depression

1929–1939

The most severe global economic depression of the 20th century, beginning with the U.S. stock market crash in 1929.

A. Dot Com Bubble Burst

2000–2001

Caused by overvaluation of internet-based companies (dot-coms) leading to a sharp fall in tech stock prices.

D. Global Financial Crisis

2008–2009

Triggered by the collapse of the U.S. housing market and failure of major financial institutions.

C. Covid Pandemic

2020–2021

Global economic slowdown due to pandemic lockdowns disrupting supply chains and demand.

 

Chronological Sequence: B → A → D → C, that is: Great Depression → Dot Com Bubble Burst → Global Financial Crisis → Covid Pandemic

Question 29
Identify the factors that determine the demand.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Price of the CommodityB. Income of the ConsumerC. Taste and Preferences of ConsumerD. Size of PopulationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and B Only
  • B.A, B and C Only
  • C.B, C and D Only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D

The demand for a commodity is influenced by several factors such as:

Price of the commodity — inversely affects demand (law of demand).

Income of the consumer — higher income generally increases demand.

Taste and preferences — if a product matches consumer preferences, demand rises.

Size of population — larger populations usually mean higher total demand.

Hence, all four factors together determine the level of demand for a product.

Question 30
Which of the following are part of microeconomics?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Product pricingB. Consumer behaviourC. Interest rateD. Factor pricingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.A, B and D Only
  • C.A and D Only
  • D.A, B, C and D
Correct Answer: A, B and D Only

Microeconomics deals with the behavior of individual economic units — such as consumers, firms, and industries — and how they make decisions about resource allocation, pricing, and production. It focuses on small components of the economy rather than the economy as a whole.

 

  • Product pricing (A), Consumer behaviour (B), and Factor pricing (D) are micro-level decisions.

 

  • Interest rate (C) relates to the overall economy, so it’s macroeconomic.
  •  

Thus, the correct answer is option (B).

Question 31
Identify the areas of macroeconomics:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. National IncomeB. Balance of PaymentsC. Level of savings and investmentD. Location of industryE. Behaviour of firmsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.B, C and E Only
  • C.B, C and D Only
  • D.A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B and C Only

Macroeconomics studies the economy as a whole — focusing on aggregate variables and overall economic performance.

  • National Income (A) ✔️
  • Balance of Payments (B) ✔️
  • Level of Savings and Investment (C) ✔️

 

These are national-level indicators.

 

Location of industry (D) and Behaviour of firms (E) relate to microeconomics, as they deal with individual decisions.

Question 32
A company hold raw material for 60 days. It gets credit from suppliers for 15 days, production process take 15 days, finished goods are held for 30 days and 30 days credit is given to debtors. Calculate the total working capital cycle.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.150 days
  • B.120 days
  • C.100 days
  • D.90 days
Correct Answer: 120 days

Working Capital Cycle =Raw Material Holding Period + Production Period + Finished Goods Holding Period + Debtors Collection Period – Creditors Payment Period

Substituting the values:
= 60 + 15 + 30 + 30 – 15 = 135 – 15 = 120 days

Question 33
A company has 10%, 20 lakh debentures. The EBIT of the company is ₹5,00,000 and the equity capitalisation rate is 16%. Calculate overall cost of capital.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.9.5%
  • B.10.8%
  • C.12.9%
  • D.14.5%
Correct Answer: 12.9%

Given:

Debentures = ₹20,00,000 at 10% interest

EBIT = ₹5,00,000

Equity capitalization rate (Ke) = 16%

 

Step 1: Calculate interest on debentures

Interest = 10% of ₹20,00,000 = ₹2,00,000

Step 2: Calculate Net Income (Earnings to Equity Shareholders)

EBIT – Interest = ₹5,00,000 – ₹2,00,000 = ₹3,00,000

Step 3: Calculate Market Value of Equity

Let the total market value of the company = V

We know that Ke = Earnings to equity / Market value of equity

0.16=3,00,000Market value of equityMarket value of equity=3,00,0000.16=₹18,75,000Step 4: Find total market value of the firm

V = Value of debt + Value of equity

= ₹20,00,000 + ₹18,75,000 = ₹38,75,000

Step 5: Calculate Overall Cost of Capital (Ko)

Ko=EBITV=5,00,00038,75,000=0.129≈12.9%

Question 34
ABC Ltd. issued 2,000, 10% preference shares of ₹100 each at ₹95. Calculate the cost of preference shares.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.8.50%
  • B.10.53%
  • C.12.35%
  • D.15.25%
Correct Answer: 10.53%

Cost of Preference Shares (Kp) = DividendNetProceeds×100

Given:

Face Value (FV) = ₹100

Dividend Rate = 10%

Issue Price (Net Proceeds) = ₹95

Kp=1095×100=10.526%≈10.53%

Question 35
A company produces and sells 10,000 toys. The selling price per toy is ₹500, variable cost is ₹200 per unit and fixed operating cost is ₹25,00,000. Calculate operating leverage.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.4 times
  • B.5 times
  • C.6 times
  • D.8 times
Correct Answer: 6 times

Given:

Output = 10,000 units

Selling price per unit = ₹500

Variable cost per unit = ₹200

Fixed cost = ₹25,00,000

 

Step 1: Calculate Contribution per unit

Contribution = Selling Price – Variable Cost

= ₹500 – ₹200 = ₹300

 

Step 2: Total Contribution

= ₹300 × 10,000 = ₹30,00,000

 

Step 3: EBIT (Earnings Before Interest and Tax)

EBIT = Total Contribution – Fixed Cost

= ₹30,00,000 – ₹25,00,000 = ₹5,00,000

 

Step 4: Operating Leverage

Operating Leverage=ContributionEBIT=30,00,0005,00,000=6

Answer: Operating Leverage = 6 times

Question 36
Which of the following are the discounted cash flow techniques of capital budgeting?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Payback PeriodB. Accounting rate of return (ARR)C. Net Present Value (NPV)D. Internal Rate of Return (IRR)E. Profitability IndexChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, C, D Only
  • B.B, C, E Only
  • C.C and D Only
  • D.C, D and E Only
Correct Answer: C, D and E Only

Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) techniques of capital budgeting consider the time value of money — meaning future cash flows are discounted to their present value.

The DCF methods include:

Net Present Value (NPV) – compares present value of cash inflows with outflows.

Internal Rate of Return (IRR) – finds the discount rate that makes NPV = 0.

Profitability Index (PI) – ratio of present value of inflows to outflows.

❌ Payback Period and Accounting Rate of Return (ARR) do not use discounting — hence, they are non-discounted methods.

Question 37
Arrange the following Development Financial Institutions in chronological order of their establishment (Old to New).(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. IFCIB. IDBIC. NABARDD. SIDBIChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, A, C, D
  • C.C, D, A, B
  • D.D, C, B, A
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D

Let’s arrange the Development Financial Institutions (DFIs) by their year of establishment (oldest to newest):

 

Institution

Full Form

Year of Establishment

Purpose

A. IFCI

Industrial Finance Corporation of India

1948

First DFI in India to provide medium and long-term finance to industries.

B. IDBI

Industrial Development Bank of India

1964

Established to coordinate other financial institutions and promote industrial development.

C. NABARD

National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development

1982

Focuses on agricultural and rural sector credit and development.

D. SIDBI

Small Industries Development Bank of India

1990

Promotes and finances small-scale industries (now MSMEs).

 

Hence, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 38
Arrange the following exchange rate arrangements of international monetary system in chronological order (Old to New).(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, A, C, D
  • C.C, B, D, A
  • D.B, C, A, D
Correct Answer: B, A, C, D

Let’s arrange the exchange rate systems in chronological order (Old to New):

 

Stage

System

B. Commodity Specie Standard

Earliest form where currency value was linked directly to precious metals like gold or silver coins. This existed before 19th century.

A. Gold Standard

Introduced in the 19th century, where the value of each currency was defined in terms of a fixed quantity of gold. Continued until World War I and revived briefly between wars.

C. Fixed Parity System

Also known as the Bretton Woods System (1944–1971) — currencies were pegged to the US dollar, and the dollar was convertible into gold.

D. Floating Exchange Rate

Introduced after 1971, when the Bretton Woods system collapsed; exchange rates began to be determined by market forces.

 

Question 39
Arrange the following steps of Multinational Capital Budgeting in correct order.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Estimate net cash flow from the projectB. Determine net investment outlayC. Apply appropriate evaluation techniqueD. Identify appropriate discount rateChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.C, A, B, D
  • C.D, C, B, A
  • D.B, A, D, C
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C

The correct sequence of steps in Multinational Capital Budgeting is:

Determine net investment outlay – Identify the initial cost required for the project, including fixed assets, working capital, and other expenses.

Estimate net cash flow from the project – Forecast expected inflows and outflows over the project’s life.

Identify appropriate discount rate – Choose a rate reflecting the project’s risk, inflation, and country-specific factors.

Apply appropriate evaluation technique – Use NPV, IRR, or other discounted cash flow techniques to assess project feasibility.

Hence, the correct order is B → A → D → C.

Question 40
Match the List–I with List–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)List–I (Concept)A. Present ValueB. Future ValueC. Future Value of AnnuityD. Present Value of AnnuityList–II (Formula)I.Cashflow×(1+r)ᵗII.Cashflow/(1+r)ᵗIII.R(PVIFi,n)IV.R(FVIFAi,n)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III
  • B.A–I, B–II, C–IV, D–III
  • C.A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II
  • D.A–I, B–III, C–II, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III

The correct answer is A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III.

Question 41
Match the List–I with List–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)List–I (Term)A. Nostro AccountB. Vostro AccountC. BidD. OfferList–II (Explanation)I. Account held by a foreign bank with a local bankII. An Indian Bank's Swiss Franc A/C with a bank in SwitzerlandIII. Price at which the dealer is willing to buy another currencyIV. Price at which the dealer is willing to sell another currencyChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
  • B.A–II, B–I, C–III, D–IV
  • C.A–III, B–II, C–IV, D–I
  • D.A–IV, B–III, C–I, D–II
Correct Answer: A–II, B–I, C–III, D–IV

Let’s match each term with its correct meaning in foreign exchange terminology:

Nostro Account (A–II): It refers to an Indian bank’s account in foreign currency maintained with a bank abroad, e.g., an Indian bank’s Swiss Franc account with a Swiss bank.

 

Vostro Account (B–I): It is an account held by a foreign bank with a local bank, i.e., “your account with us.”

 

Bid (C–III): The price at which a dealer is willing to buy another currency.

 

Offer (D–IV): The price at which a dealer is willing to sell another currency.

Question 42
What is the Harmonic Mean of two numbers whose Arithmetic Mean and Geometric Mean are 30 and 24 respectively?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.4.8
  • B.9.6
  • C.19.2
  • D.76.8
Correct Answer: 19.2

Let the two numbers be a and b.

Arithmetic Mean (A.M.) = 30

Geometric Mean (G.M.) = 24

 

We know the relationships between the means:

A.M.=a+b2, G.M.=abSubstitute the given values:

a+b2=30⇒a+b=60ab=24⇒ab=576Harmonic Mean (H.M.) formula:

H.M.=2aba+bSubstitute the values:

H.M.=2×57660=115260=19.2Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 43
Which of the following statements are correct with regard to mathematical properties of standard deviation?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Standard deviation is independent of change of origin and change of scale.B. Standard deviation is independent of change of origin but not of scale.C. The standard deviation of first n natural numbers is√(n²-1)/12.D. The standard deviation of first n natural numbers is√(n²-1)/6.E. For moderately skewed distributions standard deviation is 0.8 of mean deviation.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.B and C Only
  • B.B, C, and E Only
  • C.A and C Only
  • D.B, D and E Only
Correct Answer: B and C Only

When all observations in a dataset are increased or decreased by a constant (change of origin), the standard deviation remains unchanged because the spread of data does not change.

However, when all observations are multiplied or divided by a constant (change of scale), the standard deviation also changes by the same factor.

Hence, standard deviation is independent of change of origin but dependent on change of scale.

 

For moderately skewed distributions standard deviation is 1.25 of mean deviation and not 0.8.

Question 44
Match the LIST-I with LIST-II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)List–I (Relative measures of Skewness)A. Karl Pearson’s coefficient of skewnessB. Bowley’s coefficient of skewnessC. Kelly’s coefficient of skewnessD. Moment coefficient of skewnessList–II (Formula)I.(μ₂)²/(μ₃)II.(P90+P10-2Median)/(P90-P10)III.(Q3+Q1-2Median)/(Q3-Q1)IV. (Mean−Mode) / Standard DeviationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I
  • C.A-II, B-III, C-IV, D-I
  • D.A-III, B-IV, C-I, D-II
Correct Answer:

The correct answer is A-IV, B-III, C-II, D-I.

Question 45
Which of the following are properties of regression coefficient?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. The coefficient of correlation and the two regression coefficients have the same signs.B. The coefficient of correlation is the harmonic mean between the regression coefficients.C. If one of the regression coefficients is greater than unity, the other must also be greater than unity.D. If one of the regression coefficients is greater than unity, the other must be less than unity.E. The regression coefficientareindependent of change of origin but not of scale.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and D Only
  • B.B, C and E Only
  • C.A, B and C Only
  • D.A, D and E Only
Correct Answer: A, D and E Only

(A) ✔ True — The coefficient of correlation (r) and both regression coefficients (bxy and byx) always have the same sign.

→ (Property 2)

 

(B) ❌ False — The coefficient of correlation is the geometric mean, not the harmonic mean, of the two regression coefficients.

→ (Property 1)

 

(C) ❌ False — Both regression coefficients cannot be greater than 1 simultaneously.
→ (Property 3)

 

(D) ✔ True — If one regression coefficient is greater than unity, the other must be less than unity.

→ (Property 3)

 

(E) ✔ True — Regression coefficients are independent of change of origin but not independent of change of scale.

→ (Property 5)

Final Answer: A, D, and E

Question 46
If a random variable X follows a Poisson distribution such that P (X=1) = 4P (X=2). The variance of X is:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.1/2
  • B.1
  • C.2
  • D.1/4
Correct Answer: 1/2

. The calculations are given below:

 

The correct answer is ½.

Question 47
Identify the correct sequence of Research Design Process:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Measurement technique selectionB. Research approach selectionC. Data collection technique selectionD. Sample design selectionE. Data analysis method selectionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D, E
  • B.B, A, D, C, E
  • C.D, C, E, A, B
  • D.C, E, D, B, A
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C, E

The correct sequence of steps in the Research Design Process is:

Research approach selection (B) – Decide whether the study will be exploratory, descriptive, causal, etc.

Measurement technique selection (A) – Determine how variables will be measured or quantified (e.g., scales, instruments).

Sample design selection (D) – Choose the target population, sampling method, and sample size.

Data collection technique selection (C) – Select methods like interviews, surveys, observation, or secondary data.

Data analysis method selection (E) – Plan how the collected data will be processed and analyzed statistically.

Hence, the correct order is B → A → D → C → E.

Question 48
The questions that are asked from the respondent are known as:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Management Questions
  • B.Research Questions
  • C.Investigative Questions
  • D.Measurement Questions
Correct Answer: Measurement Questions

In a research study:

Management questions define the decision problem.

Research questions specify what needs to be studied to solve that problem.

Investigative questions break research questions into specific components or hypotheses.

Measurement questions are the actual questions asked from respondents in a questionnaire or interview to collect data.

Hence, the correct answer is Measurement Questions.

Question 49
Identify the correct sequence of sampling design process:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Determine the Sample sizeB. Select a sampling techniqueC. Selection of sampling frameD. Defining target populationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D
  • B.B, A, D, C
  • C.A, B, D, C
  • D.D, C, B, A
Correct Answer: D, C, B, A

The correct sequence of steps in the Sampling Design Process is:

Defining target population (D) – Specify the group of elements about which information is required.

Selection of sampling frame (C) – Identify the list or source from which the sample will be drawn.

Select a sampling technique (B) – Decide the method to choose samples (e.g., random, stratified, cluster).

Determine the sample size (A) – Decide how many elements will be included in the sample.

Hence, the logical order is D → C → B → A.

Question 50
The parametric test that can be used for hypothesis testing of paired samples is:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.t test
  • B.z test
  • C.Chi-Square test
  • D.Mann-Whitney test
Correct Answer: t test

The paired-sample t-test (also called the dependent t-test) is the parametric test used when two sets of related observations are compared — for example, before-and-after measurements on the same subjects.

It tests whether the mean difference between paired observations is statistically significant.

Other options:

z-test: Used for large samples with known population variance.

Chi-square test: A non-parametric test used for frequencies or categorical data.

Mann-Whitney test: A non-parametric alternative to the independent-sample t-test (used for unrelated samples).

 

Question 51
Match the LIST-I with LIST-II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)List–I (Components commonly present in reports)A. Prefatory InformationB. Introductory InformationC. Main Research BodyD. Supplementary InformationList–II (Contents)I. Executive SummaryII. GlossaryIII. Problem DefinitionIV. Research DesignChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A-I, B-II, C-III, D-IV
  • B.A-II, B-I, C-IV, D-III
  • C.A-I, B-III, C-II, D-IV
  • D.A-I, B-III, C-IV, D-II
Correct Answer: A-I, B-III, C-IV, D-II

The correct matching is as follows:

A. Prefatory Information → I. Executive Summary
Prefatory part includes title page, acknowledgements, and executive summary — giving an overview of the entire report.

B. Introductory Information → III. Problem Definition
The introduction explains the background and defines the research problem or purpose.

C. Main Research Body → IV. Research Design
The main body includes methodology, data analysis, and research design details.

D. Supplementary Information → II. Glossary
Supplementary sections include appendices, glossary, references, and additional data.

✅ Hence, the correct answer is A–I, B–III, C–IV, D–II.

Question 52
A type of validity which demonstrates statistically a relationship between scores on a selection procedure and job performance is called:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Test validity
  • B.Criterion validity
  • C.Content validity
  • D.Construct validity
Correct Answer: Criterion validity

Criterion validity measures how well the results of a test or selection tool correlate with actual job performance or another relevant criterion. It is established statistically by comparing test scores with performance outcomes (e.g., productivity, ratings, or training success).

Content validity: Examines whether the test covers all aspects of the concept.

Construct validity: Checks whether the test truly measures the theoretical construct it claims to measure.

Test validity: A general term for the overall accuracy of a test.

Question 53
The ongoing process of systematically identifying, assessing and developing organisational leadership to enhance performance is known as:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Strategy and Workforce planning
  • B.Predictive Workforce Monitoring
  • C.Succession Planning
  • D.Managerial Judgement
Correct Answer: Succession Planning

Succession planning is the systematic process of identifying, assessing, and developing future leaders in an organisation to ensure smooth leadership continuity and enhanced performance. It focuses on preparing employees to fill key positions when they become vacant.

Question 54
Keeping a record of uncommonly good or undesirable examples of an employee's work-related behaviour and reviewing it with the employee at pre-determined times is known as:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.BehaviorallyAnchored Rating Scale
  • B.Critical Incident Method
  • C.Paired Comparison Method
  • D.Mixed Standard Scales
Correct Answer: Critical Incident Method

The Critical Incident Method involves keeping a record of particularly good or poor examples of an employee’s behaviour related to job performance. These incidents are later discussed during appraisal to provide specific feedback and improve performance.

Question 55
Matrix Structure can be made more effective by following which of the guidelines given below?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Collective learning, coordination and integration of skills for obtaining the streams of technology.B. Define the objectives of the project or task.C. Clarify the roles, authority and responsibilities of managers and team members.D. Ensure that influence is based on knowledge, information, rather than on rank.E. Balance the power of functional and project managers.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D Only
  • B.A, B, D and E Only
  • C.B, C, D and E Only
  • D.A, B, C, E Only
Correct Answer: B, C, D and E Only

A Matrix Structure combines both functional and project-based structures — employees report to two managers: one functional and one project. This structure helps improve coordination and flexibility but can also create confusion or conflict if not well managed.

 

To make it effective, certain management guidelines must be followed:

 

1️⃣ Define the Objectives of the Project (B): Clear project goals ensure that all departments understand the purpose and expected outcomes. It minimizes conflict and duplication of effort.

 

2️⃣ Clarify Roles, Authority, and Responsibilities (C): Each manager and team member must have well-defined authority and duties. This avoids confusion over “who reports to whom” in the dual reporting system.

 

3️⃣ Ensure Influence Based on Knowledge, Not Rank (D): Decision-making should depend on expertise and information, not hierarchy. This encourages cooperation and learning across functions.

 

4️⃣ Balance the Power of Functional and Project Managers (E): Both managers should have equal authority in their domains to prevent dominance by one side. Proper balance promotes smooth coordination.

 

Option A, i.e., “Collective learning, coordination, and integration of skills” describe objectives of matrix structure, not guidelines for making it effective.

Question 56
Match the LIST-I with LIST-II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)List–I (Job Related Terms)A. Job enlargementB. Job descriptionsC. Job specificationsD. Job enrichmentList–II (Explanation)I. A list of jobs 'human requirements', i.e. the requisite education, skills, personality etc.II. A list of job duties, responsibilities, reporting relationships, working conditions and supervisory responsibilities.III. Assigning workers additional same level activities.IV. Redesigning jobs in a way that increases the opportunities for the workers to experience feelings of responsibility, achievement, growth and recognition.Options:
  • A.A–III, B–II, C–I, D–IV
  • B.A–IV, B–II, C–I, D–III
  • C.A–III, B–I, C–II, D–IV
  • D.A–IV, B–II, C–III, D–I
Correct Answer: A–III, B–II, C–I, D–IV

The correct match is as follows:

 

List–I (Job Related Terms)

List–II (Explanation)

Reason

A. Job Enlargement

III. Assigning workers additional same level activities

Job enlargement means increasing the number of tasks performed by an employee at the same level to reduce monotony.

B. Job Description

II. A list of job duties, responsibilities, reporting relationships, working conditions and supervisory responsibilities

It provides a written statement of what a job holder is expected to do.

C. Job Specification

I. A list of jobs ‘human requirements’, i.e., the requisite education, skills, personality etc.

It states the minimum qualifications and personal traits required for performing the job.

D. Job Enrichment

IV. Redesigning jobs to increase opportunities for responsibility, achievement, and growth

Job enrichment adds motivating factors and decision-making authority, enhancing job satisfaction.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

 

Question 57
The State Bank of India came into existence in the year:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.1947
  • B.1950
  • C.1955
  • D.1969
Correct Answer: 1955

The State Bank of India (SBI) was established on 1st July 1955.

Question 58
A term loan becomes Non Performing Asset (NPA) if its interest and/or instalment of principal remains overdue for a period of more than:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.30 days
  • B.60 days
  • C.75 days
  • D.90 days
Correct Answer: 90 days

As per the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) guidelines, a term loan is classified as a Non-Performing Asset (NPA) if the interest and/or instalment of principal remains overdue for a period of more than 90 days.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 59
An unsecured short term promissory note, negotiable and transferable by endorsement and delivery with a fixed maturity period, issued at a discount by creditworthy corporates, primary dealers and all-India financial institutions is known as:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Treasury Bill
  • B.Commercial Paper
  • C.Certificates of Deposit
  • D.Repo
Correct Answer: Commercial Paper

A Commercial Paper (CP) is an unsecured, short-term, negotiable instrument issued by creditworthy corporates, primary dealers, and financial institutions to meet their short-term funding needs.

Question 60
Arrange the following in chronological order of the Milestones achieved by the National Stock Exchange of India:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Commencement of Trading in Index optionsB. Launch of securities Lending and Borrowing SchemeC. Commencement of Derivatives Trading in Index FuturesD. Launch of Mutual Fund Service SystemE. Launch of S & P CNX NiftyOptions:
  • A.B, D, E, A, C
  • B.A, C, E, B, D
  • C.E, A, C, D, B
  • D.E, C, A, B, D
Correct Answer: E, C, A, B, D

Let’s arrange the major milestones of the National Stock Exchange (NSE) in chronological order (oldest to newest):

 

Event

Year

Description

E. Launch of S & P CNX Nifty

1996

Benchmark index of NSE introduced, representing 50 major stocks.

C. Commencement of Derivatives Trading in Index Futures

2000

NSE started futures trading on Nifty Index — the first derivatives product in India.

A. Commencement of Trading in Index Options

2001

NSE introduced trading in Nifty Index Options.

B. Launch of Securities Lending and Borrowing Scheme (SLBS)

2008

Enabled lending and borrowing of securities for short selling and settlement efficiency.

D. Launch of Mutual Fund Service System (MFSS)

2009

Provided an online platform for purchase and redemption of mutual fund units through brokers.

 

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 61
In which of the following year Investor Protection and Education Fund Regulations was issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.1992
  • B.1999
  • C.2003
  • D.2009
Correct Answer: 2009

The Investor Protection and Education Fund Regulations was issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India in the year 2009.

Question 62
Symbols, Icons, Rituals and values are the manifestations of:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Social class
  • B.Culture
  • C.Sub-culture
  • D.Social Factors
Correct Answer: Culture

Symbols, icons, rituals, and values are outward expressions of culture — the shared beliefs, traditions, and behaviours that define a society or organisation. These elements together reflect how people think, act, and relate within that cultural group.

Question 63
The term ‘marketing myopia’ was coined by:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Philip Kotler
  • B.Gary Armstrong
  • C.Peter Drucker
  • D.Theodore Levitt
Correct Answer: Theodore Levitt

The term “Marketing Myopia” was coined by Theodore Levitt in his famous 1960 Harvard Business Review article.

 

It refers to a company’s short-sighted focus on selling products rather than fulfilling customer needs.

 

Levitt emphasized that businesses should view themselves as serving customer needs, not just producing goods — for example, rail companies should see themselves in the transportation business, not just the rail business.

Question 64
According to Levitt and Drucker, the essence of marketing is:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Profit Orientation
  • B.Product Orientation
  • C.Market Orientation
  • D.Customer Orientation
Correct Answer: Customer Orientation

Both Theodore Levitt and Peter Drucker emphasized that the core of marketing lies in understanding and satisfying customer needs rather than merely focusing on products or profits.

 

Peter Drucker stated: “The aim of marketing is to know and understand the customer so well that the product or service fits him and sells itself.”

 

Theodore Levitt argued against “marketing myopia,” urging firms to focus on customers’ needs, not just the goods they produce.

 

Hence, the true essence of marketing is Customer Orientation — creating value for customers to ensure long-term business success.

Question 65
Arrange the following human needs as per Maslow's Hierarchy of needs.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Social NeedsB. Safety NeedsC. Esteem NeedsD. Physiological NeedsE. Self-actualisation NeedsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.D, B, A, C, E
  • B.A, B, C, D, E
  • C.B, D, C, E, A
  • D.D, A, B, C, E
Correct Answer: D, B, A, C, E

According to Abraham Maslow’s Hierarchy of Needs Theory, human needs are arranged in a five-level pyramid, progressing from basic to higher-level needs.

 

Each level must be at least partially satisfied before moving to the next.

 

Order of Needs (from lowest to highest):

 

D. Physiological Needs – Basic survival needs such as food, water, shelter, and rest.

 

B. Safety Needs – Security, stability, protection, and freedom from fear.

 

A. Social Needs – Belongingness, love, friendship, and relationships.

 

C. Esteem Needs – Respect, recognition, self-confidence, and status.

 

E. Self-actualisation Needs – Realising one’s full potential, creativity, and personal growth.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 66
Arrange the following stages of Adoption process in correct order.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. InterestB. AwarenessC. TrialD. EvaluationE. AdoptionChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, D, C, B, E
  • B.A, B, C, D, E
  • C.B, C, A, E, D
  • D.B, A, D, C, E
Correct Answer: B, A, D, C, E

The Adoption Process describes the mental stages a consumer goes through from first learning about a new product to finally accepting it.

 

Stages in Correct Order are as follows:

 

B. Awareness – The consumer first becomes aware of the new product but lacks detailed information.

 

A. Interest – The consumer shows curiosity and seeks more information about the product.

 

D. Evaluation – The consumer assesses whether trying the product makes sense or is worth it.

 

C. Trial – The consumer tries the product on a small scale to determine its value.

 

E. Adoption – The consumer decides to make full and regular use of the product.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 67
Which of the following methods belong to the category of demand/market-based pricing?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Surge pricingB. Premium pricingC. ‘What the traffic can bear’ pricingD. Discount pricingE. Parity pricingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C and D Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.A, B and C Only
  • D.C, D and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B and C Only

Demand-based or market-based pricing refers to setting prices primarily according to consumer demand and market conditions, rather than costs or competitors’ prices.

 

Included Methods:

 

A. Surge Pricing ✔️ Price changes dynamically based on real-time demand (e.g., Uber fare hikes during peak hours). Reflects direct response to market demand.

 

B. Premium Pricing ✔️ Charging a higher price to reflect superior quality, exclusivity, or brand image.

Based on customers’ willingness to pay — a demand-driven approach.

 

C. ‘What the Traffic Can Bear’ Pricing ✔️ Setting the maximum price consumers are willing to pay.

Entirely demand-oriented.

 

Not Included:

 

D. Discount Pricing ❌ A sales promotion strategy, not strictly demand-based — aimed at boosting short-term sales.

 

E. Parity Pricing ❌ Based on competitors’ prices, hence a competition-based pricing method.

Question 68
Arrange the following steps of New Product Development in sequential order:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Product DevelopmentB. Feasibility AnalysisC. Concept Development and TestingD. Identifying Prospective customersE. Idea GenerationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, E, D
  • B.D, E, B, C, A
  • C.E, D, C, B, A
  • D.E, B, C, A, D
Correct Answer: E, D, C, B, A

The New Product Development (NPD) process outlines the sequence of steps involved in bringing a new product from idea to market. The correct order ensures systematic evaluation and minimizes risks.

 

Steps in Sequential Order are as follows:

 

E. Idea Generation → The process starts with creating new product ideas from various sources — customers, employees, R&D, competitors, etc.

 

D. Identifying Prospective Customers → Before moving further, companies identify the potential target market for the idea — to understand for whom the product is being developed.

 

C. Concept Development and Testing → The selected idea is turned into a concept and tested with these prospective customers for their reaction and acceptance.

 

B. Feasibility Analysis → After concept testing, a detailed technical and financial feasibility study is conducted to check if the concept is viable.

 

A. Product Development → Finally, the actual product prototype is developed based on the results of earlier stages.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 69
Geographical Price differentials include which of the following?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. F.O.B Factory PricingB. Zone PricingC. Loss Leader PricingD. Postage Stamp PricingE. Basing Point PricingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C and D Only
  • B.B, C, D and E Only
  • C.A, B, D and E Only
  • D.B, D and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B, D and E Only

Geographical Price Differentials refer to price variations made by a seller based on the buyer’s geographical location or distance from the point of production or sale.

These methods help firms adjust prices to account for transportation costs and market conditions across regions.

 

Included Methods:

 

A. F.O.B. Factory Pricing ✔️ - “Free on Board” factory price — the buyer bears freight and transportation costs from the seller’s factory to destination. Price differs by location due to varying delivery costs.

 

B. Zone Pricing ✔️ - Different prices are set for different geographical zones. Buyers within the same zone pay the same price, regardless of distance.

 

D. Postage Stamp Pricing ✔️ - A uniform delivered price — all buyers, regardless of location, pay the same price (like postal rates). Example: A product costs ₹100 for all customers across India, even if shipping costs differ.

 

E. Basing Point Pricing ✔️ - Prices are quoted based on a selected basing point city, and freight is calculated from that point, even if shipment originates elsewhere.

 

Not Included:

 

C. Loss Leader Pricing ❌ - This is a promotional pricing strategy, not a geographical one — used to attract customers by offering some products below cost.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 70
Match the LIST–I with LIST–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)LIST–IA. PerceptionB. LearningC. BeliefD. AttitudeLIST–III. A descriptive thought that a person holds about something.II. A person’s consistently favourable or unfavourable evaluations, feelings and tendencies toward an object or idea.III. Changes in an individual’s behaviour arising from experience.IV. The process by which people select, organise and interpret information to form a meaningful picture of the world.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
  • B.A–III, B–IV, C–II, D–I
  • C.A–IV, B–III, C–I, D–II
  • D.A–II, B–III, C–I, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–IV, B–III, C–I, D–II

The correct match is as follows:

 

LIST–I (Term)

LIST–II (Explanation)

Reason

A. Perception

IV. The process by which people select, organise and interpret information to form a meaningful picture of the world.

Perception shapes how individuals interpret stimuli and form understanding of their environment.

B. Learning

III. Changes in an individual’s behaviour arising from experience.

Learning modifies behaviour through experience, practice, or reinforcement.

C. Belief

I. A descriptive thought that a person holds about something.

Beliefs represent what people consider true about products, brands, or ideas.

D. Attitude

II. A person’s consistently favourable or unfavourable evaluations, feelings and tendencies toward an object or idea.

Attitude reflects lasting feelings or predispositions toward something.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 71
Match the LIST–I with LIST–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)LIST–I (Stages of Product Life Cycle)A. IntroductionB. GrowthC. MaturityD. DeclineLIST–II (Types of Customers)I. LaggardsII. Early adoptersIII. Middle majorityIV. InnovatorsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
  • B.A–II, B–III, C–I, D–IV
  • C.A–IV, B–II, C–III, D–I
  • D.A–III, B–II, C–IV, D–I
Correct Answer: A–IV, B–II, C–III, D–I

In the Product Life Cycle (PLC), different customer groups adopt a product at different stages based on their willingness to try new innovations.

 

Stage (LIST–I)

Customer Type (LIST–II)

Description

A. Introduction

IV. Innovators

The first to try a new product; risk-takers and adventurous.

B. Growth

II. Early Adopters

Opinion leaders who influence others; accept innovation after initial success.

C. Maturity

III. Middle Majority

Practical buyers who adopt once the product is well established and widely accepted.

D. Decline

I. Laggards

Last group to adopt; prefer traditional products and resist change.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 72
In India, the term of every utility patent granted shall be of ______ years.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.10
  • B.20
  • C.30
  • D.50
Correct Answer: 20

In India, under the Patents Act, 1970 (as amended in 2005), the term of every utility patent — that is, a patent granted for an invention — is 20 years from the date of filing of the patent application, whether filed in India or under the Patent Cooperation Treaty (PCT).

Question 73
“Active concealment of fact” is associated with which one of the following?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Misrepresentation
  • B.Undue influence
  • C.Fraud
  • D.Mistake
Correct Answer: Fraud

Under the Indian Contract Act, 1872, “active concealment of fact” is one of the acts that constitutes fraud.

 

According to Section 17 of the Indian Contract Act, Fraud includes:

  • Suggestion of a false fact by a person who does not believe it to be true.
  • Active concealment of a fact by one having knowledge or belief of the fact.
  • Promise made without intention to perform it.
  • Any act fitted to deceive.
  • Any act or omission declared fraudulent by law.

 

“Active concealment” means deliberately hiding or suppressing a material fact that one has a duty to disclose, with an intention to deceive another party.

Question 74
Which of the following is a horizontal agreement?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Tie in arrangement
  • B.Resale Price maintenance
  • C.Cartel
  • D.Exclusive Distribution
Correct Answer: Cartel

In competition law, agreements between firms are classified as horizontal or vertical depending on the relationship between the parties.

 

1️⃣ Horizontal Agreement: It is an agreement between enterprises operating at the same level of the production or distribution chain (e.g., two manufacturers or two wholesalers).

 

These agreements usually aim to reduce competition among themselves.

 

Example: Formation of a cartel, price-fixing, market sharing, or bid rigging.

 

Hence, Cartel is a horizontal agreement.

 

2️⃣ Vertical Agreements: Occur between firms at different levels of the supply chain (e.g., manufacturer and distributor).

 

Examples:

(A) Tie-in arrangement

(B) Resale price maintenance

(D) Exclusive distribution

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 75
Arrange the following steps of incorporation of a new Limited Liability Partnership in proper sequence.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Reserve LLP NameB. Preparation of Documents for Incorporation of LLPC. Procure Digital Signature CertificateD. LLP incorporation and DIN Application and apply for PAN and TANE. Drafting and filling LLP AgreementChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.B, A, C, D, E
  • B.A, B, C, E, D
  • C.C, A, B, D, E
  • D.D, E, B, A, C
Correct Answer: C, A, B, D, E

The incorporation of a Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) in India follows a well-defined sequence under the Limited Liability Partnership Act, 2008 and the MCA (Ministry of Corporate Affairs) procedures.

 

Correct Stepwise Process is as follows:

 

C. Procure Digital Signature Certificate (DSC): Every designated partner must obtain a Digital Signature Certificate to sign and file electronic documents with the MCA portal.

 

A. Reserve LLP Name: Apply for name approval through the RUN-LLP (Reserve Unique Name) service on the MCA portal.

 

B. Preparation of Documents for Incorporation of LLP: Prepare incorporation documents such as partners’ details, address proof, consent forms, etc.

 

D. LLP Incorporation and DIN Application, and Apply for PAN & TAN: File the FiLLiP Form (Form for Incorporation of LLP) with MCA, which also includes DIN allotment for designated partners and application for PAN and TAN.

 

E. Drafting and Filing LLP Agreement: Within 30 days of incorporation, file the LLP Agreement (Form 3) defining partners’ rights and duties.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 76
Who can file petition to the Tribunal for the Winding up of a Limited Liability Partnership?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Secured CreditorsB. LLP or any of its PartnersC. Registrar of CompaniesD. Any person authorised by the central GovernmentE. Any Voluntary AssociationChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C Only
  • B.A and B Only
  • C.A, B, C and D Only
  • D.B, C and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D Only

A petition for winding up of an LLP can be presented to the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) by the following parties:

 

A. Secured Creditors ✔️ – A creditor (secured or unsecured) can file a petition if the LLP is unable to pay its debts.

 

B. The LLP or any of its Partners ✔️– The LLP itself, or any of its partners, may apply voluntarily for winding up.

 

C. Registrar of Companies (ROC) ✔️ – The Registrar can file a petition if he believes the LLP is acting against the interests of sovereignty, integrity, or public order, etc.

 

D. Any Person Authorised by the Central Government ✔️– The Central Government may empower certain authorities to file a petition for winding up on specific grounds.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 77
Arrange the following steps involved in the process of Voluntary Liquidation of a Limited Liability Partnership in correct order.(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Declaration of SolvencyB. Designated Partners’ MeetingC. Partners’ MeetingD. Identification of an Insolvency Professional as liquidatorE. Filing of resolutions with registrar of Companies and Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India (IBBI)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C, D, E
  • B.C, B, D, A, E
  • C.A, D, B, C, E
  • D.E, D, C, B, A
Correct Answer:

The Voluntary Liquidation process of a Limited Liability Partnership (LLP) is governed by the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC), 2016 and the LLP (Winding-up and Dissolution) Rules, 2012.

It applies when the LLP is solvent and wishes to wind up voluntarily.

 

Stepwise Process is as follows:

 

A. Declaration of Solvency ✅ The designated partners must make a declaration that the LLP has no debt or will be able to pay its debts in full within a specified period. This declaration is accompanied by a statement of assets and liabilities and an auditor’s report.

 

D. Identification of an Insolvency Professional as Liquidator ✅ A liquidator (Insolvency Professional) is proposed and appointed to carry out the liquidation process.

 

B. Designated Partners’ Meeting ✅ The designated partners formally approve the proposal for voluntary liquidation and the appointment of the liquidator.

 

C. Partners’ Meeting ✅ The proposal is then placed before the partners for approval through a special resolution, confirming the decision to liquidate.

 

E. Filing of Resolutions with Registrar of Companies and IBBI ✅ Finally, the resolution for voluntary liquidation is filed with the ROC and IBBI within the prescribed time frame to make the process official.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 78
In case of transmission of shares, which of the following is correct?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. No instrument of transfer is required.B. Transmission of securities is generally made without any consideration.C. Shares continue to be subject to the original liabilities.D. Transmission takes place on death or insolvency of a holder of securities.E. Stamp duty is payable on transmission of securities.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B, C and D Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.C, D and E Only
  • D.A, B, C Only
Correct Answer: A, B, C and D Only

Transmission of shares occurs by operation of law, not by voluntary transfer. It usually happens due to death, insolvency, or lunacy of a shareholder. The process and rights of legal heirs or representatives are governed by the Companies Act, 2013 and company’s Articles of Association.

 

Correct Statements:

 

A. No instrument of transfer is required. ✔️ - Since transmission happens automatically by law, no transfer deed (Form SH-4) is required.

 

B. Transmission of securities is generally made without any consideration. ✔️ - It’s not a sale; ownership passes legally to the heir or representative without payment.

 

C. Shares continue to be subject to the original liabilities. ✔️ - The legal heir inherits both the rights and liabilities attached to the shares.

 

D. Transmission takes place on death or insolvency of a holder of securities. ✔️ - These are the common causes of transmission.

 

No stamp duty is payable since it’s not a transfer by an act of parties.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 79
Match the LIST–I with LIST–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)LIST–IA. Section 2 (85)B. Section 455C. Section 378AD. Section 2 (6)LIST–III. Associate CompanyII. Producer CompanyIII. Dormant CompanyIV. Small CompanyChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
  • B.A–I, B–III, C–II, D–IV
  • C.A–II, B–III, C–I, D–IV
  • D.A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I
Correct Answer: A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I

The correct match is as follows:

 

LIST–IList II

A. Section 2 (85) -Small Company

B. Section 455 -Dormant Company

C. Section 378A - Producer Company

D. Section 2 (6) - Associate Company

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 80
What rights does an unpaid seller have against the goods?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Right of lienB. Right to sue for specific performanceC. Right of resaleD. Right of stoppage of goods in transitE. Right to reorganise possession of goodsChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.C, D and E Only
  • D.A, C, D Only
Correct Answer: A, C, D Only

Under the Sale of Goods Act, 1930, an unpaid seller has two categories of rights:

 

1️⃣ Rights Against the Goods: These rights are available so long as the seller retains control over the goods or has the right to regain possession.

 

Right

Meaning

A. Right of Lien

The right to retain possession of goods until payment is made.

C. Right of Resale

The right to resell the goods if the buyer defaults, after giving due notice.

D. Right of Stoppage of Goods in Transit

The right to stop goods in transit if the buyer becomes insolvent before delivery.

 

2️⃣ Rights Against the Buyer Personally:

  • Right to sue for the price.
  • Right to sue for damages.
  • Right to sue for interest.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 81
What is the primary liability of the drawer of a bill of exchange or cheque?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Liability to compensate the holder in case of dishonour.
  • B.Liability to pay the amount at maturity.
  • C.Liability to provide sufficient funds to the drawee.
  • D.Liability to pay the holder without any condition.
Correct Answer: Liability to compensate the holder in case of dishonour.

Under the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881, the drawer is the person who makes or draws a bill of exchange or cheque directing the drawee (bank or another party) to pay a certain sum to the payee or holder.

 

Primary Liability: The drawer is not primarily liable to pay the amount — the drawee or acceptor (in the case of a bill) or bank (in the case of a cheque) is.

 

However, if the bill or cheque is dishonoured, the drawer becomes liable to compensate the holder for the amount due, along with any reasonable expenses incurred due to dishonour.

 

Therefore, the drawer’s primary liability arises upon dishonour, making him liable to compensate the holder.

Question 82
If the employee pays tax within the parameters of alternative tax regime under section 115BACthen from assessment year 2025-26, standard deduction from salary income is:
  • A.NIL
  • B.₹50,000 or gross salary, whichever is lower
  • C.₹75,000 or gross salary, whichever is lower
  • D.₹40,000 or gross salary, whichever is lower
Correct Answer: ₹75,000 or gross salary, whichever is lower

If an employee pays tax under the alternative tax regime (Section 115BAC), the standard deduction from salary income for Assessment Year 2025–26 is ₹75,000 or gross salary, whichever is lower. The Union Budget of 2024 increased the standard deduction for the new tax regime from ₹50,000 to ₹75,000, effective from Financial Year 2024–25, which corresponds to Assessment Year 2025–26.

Question 83
Match the LIST–I with LIST–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)LIST–I (Item)A. Deduction in respect of medical insurance premiumB. Deduction in case of a person with disabilityC. Deduction in respect of interest on loan taken for higher educationD. Deduction in respect of contribution toAgnipathSchemeLIST–II (Section)I. Section 80CCHII. Section 80DIII. Section 80UIV. Section 80EChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–IV, B–I, C–II, D–III
  • B.A–III, B–IV, C–I, D–II
  • C.A–II, B–III, C–IV, D–I
  • D.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
Correct Answer: A–II, B–III, C–IV, D–I

The correct match is as follows:

 

LIST–I (Item) LIST–II (Section)

A. Deduction in respect of medical insurance premiumSection 80D

B. Deduction in case of a person with disabilitySection 80U

C. Deduction in respect of interest on loan taken for higher educationSection 80E

D. Deduction in respect of contribution to Agnipath SchemeSection 80CCH

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 84
The scheme of partial integration of tax of non-agricultural income with income derived from agricultural is applicable if an individual has:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Non-Agricultural income of more than the exemption limit or agricultural income exceeding ₹5000
  • B.Non-Agricultural income of more than the exemption limit or agricultural income exceeding ₹2500
  • C.Non-Agricultural income of more than the exemption limit and agricultural income exceeding ₹2500
  • D.Non-Agricultural income of more than the exemption limit and agricultural income exceeding ₹5000
Correct Answer: Non-Agricultural income of more than the exemption limit and agricultural income exceeding ₹5000

D

EXP. Under the Income Tax Act, 1961, the scheme of partial integration is used to calculate tax when a taxpayer has both agricultural and non-agricultural income. It ensures that agricultural income (which is exempt) is considered for rate purposes, so that higher-income individuals do not avoid higher tax rates.

 

Partial integration applies only if:

  • The non-agricultural income exceeds the basic exemption limit, and
  • The agricultural income exceeds ₹5,000 during the financial year.

 

If either of these conditions is not met, the scheme does not apply.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (D).

Question 85
In case the income of an individual includes the income of ₹25,000 of his minor child in terms of section 64(1A), such individual shall be entitled to an exemption under section 10(32) of:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.₹25,000
  • B.₹1,500
  • C.₹2,500
  • D.₹15,000
Correct Answer: ₹1,500

Under Section 64(1A) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, the income of a minor child (except income earned through the child’s own skill or talent) is clubbed with the income of the parent whose total income is higher.

 

However, Section 10(32) provides a small exemption to reduce the tax burden on the parent.

 

Exemption Limit under Section 10(32):

 

  • The parent is entitled to a deduction of ₹1,500 per child,
  • Maximum for up to two minor children whose income is clubbed.

 

So, if the income of ₹25,000 from a minor child is included in the parent’s income,

👉 Exemption allowed = ₹1,500 only

Question 86
Which of the following requirements have to be satisfied in order that an assessee is entitled to claim deduction under section 91 for doubly taxed income?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. The assessee must have been non-resident in India in the relevant previous year.B. The assessee must have been resident in India in the relevant previous year.C. Income must have been accrued or arisen to him during that previous year in India.D. Income must have been accrued or arisen to him during that previous year outside India.E. In respect of that income which accrued or arose outside India, he must have paid by deduction or otherwise tax under the law in force in the country in question.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and C Only
  • B.B and D Only
  • C.B, D and E Only
  • D.A, C and E Only
Correct Answer: B, D and E Only

Section 91 of the Income Tax Act, 1961 deals with relief in case of double taxation — when an Indian resident earns income from a foreign country with which India does not have a Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement (DTAA).

 

Conditions to Claim Deduction under Section 91:

 

B. The assessee must have been resident in India in the relevant previous year. ✔️

 

Only residents are taxed on global income and can claim relief for income taxed abroad.

 

D. Income must have been accrued or arisen to him during that previous year outside India. ✔️

 

The income should arise or accrue outside India, not domestically.

 

E. In respect of that income, tax must have been paid in the foreign country. ✔️

 

Relief is allowed only if tax has actually been paid (by deduction or otherwise) in that foreign country.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 87
Arm’s length price as per section 92F is the price applied or proposed to be applied when:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.Two unrelated persons enter into a transaction in uncontrolled conditions
  • B.Two related persons enter into a transaction in uncontrolled conditions
  • C.Two unrelated persons enter into a transaction in controlled conditions
  • D.Two related persons enter into a transaction in controlled conditions
Correct Answer: Two unrelated persons enter into a transaction in uncontrolled conditions

Under Section 92F(ii) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, the term Arm’s Length Price (ALP) refers to:

 

"arm's length price" means a price which is applied or proposed to be applied in a transaction between persons other than associated enterprises, in uncontrolled conditions.

 

Arm’s Length Price ensures that related parties (e.g., parent and subsidiary companies) transact as if they were unrelated, to prevent manipulation of profits or tax evasion.

 

Controlled conditions mean transactions between associated enterprises, while uncontrolled conditions refer to market-based dealings between independent parties.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (A).

Question 88
Any assessee (except an eligible assessee in respect of an eligible business referred to in section 44AD or 44ADA) must payupto75 percent of advance tax payable:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)
  • A.On or before June 15 of the previous year
  • B.On or before September 15 of the previous year
  • C.On or before December 15 of the previous year
  • D.On or before March 15 of the previous year
Correct Answer: On or before December 15 of the previous year

Advance tax is paid by all persons irrespective of the residential status of the person, i.e., by both corporate assessees and non-corporate assessees. The advance tax is to be paid in instalments on the following dates:

 

FOR BOTH INDIVIDUAL AND CORPORATE TAX PAYERS

Due Date for payment of advance taxAdvance Tax Payable

On or before 15th June15% of advance tax

On or before 15th September45% of advance tax less advance tax already paid

On or before 15th December75% of advance tax less advance tax already paid

On or before 15th March100% of advance tax less advance tax already paid

 

FOR TAXPAYERS OPTED FOR PRESUMPTIVE TAXATION SCHEME

Due DateAdvance Tax Payable

by 15th March100% of advance tax

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 89
Which of the following statements are correct with regard to tax avoidance?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. Tax avoidance is legitimate arrangement of affairs in such a way so as to minimize tax liability.B. There is an element ofmalafidemotive involved in tax avoidance.C. Tax avoidance takes into account the loop-holes of law.D. Tax avoidance is intentional attempt to avoid payment of tax after the liability to tax has arisen.E. Tax avoidance is same as tax omission.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A and C Only
  • B.A, B and C Only
  • C.B, D and E Only
  • D.A, C and E Only
Correct Answer: A and C Only

Tax avoidance is reducing or negating tax liability in legally permissible ways and has legal sanctions.

 

The main features of tax avoidance are:

(a) Legitimate arrangement of affairs in such a way so as to minimize tax liability.

(b) Avoidance of tax is not ‘tax evasion’ and carries no public disgrace with it.

(c) An act valid in law cannot be treated as fictitious, merely, on the basis of some underlying motive supposedly resulting in lower payment of tax to authorities.

(d) There is no element of malafide motive involved in tax avoidance.

 

For example, if Rs. 50,000 is gifted by a husband to his wife, income generated, therefrom, is taxable in the hands of husband, under the clubbing provisions of Sec. 64(1). The said Section is not applicable, if gift is made by the same person out of the funds of his HUF, in capacity as karta of the family.

 

If gift is made by karta of the family to his wife, clubbing provisions can be avoided and ultimate tax liability will be reduced. However, the tax liability will be reduced by taking the help of a loophole in the law but within the legal framework. This is referred to as ‘Tax Avoidance’.

 

Thus, only statement A and C are correct, making option (A) correct.

Question 90
Which of the following statements are correct?(UGC NET Commerce June2025)A. If a company is an Indian company, it will automatically be considered as a domestic company.B. Foreign company means a company which is not a domestic company.C. The residential status of an Indian company can be non-resident in India.D. The residential status of aForeigncompany can never be resident in India.E. Foreign income is taxable in the hands of company resident in India.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A, B and C Only
  • B.B, C and D Only
  • C.A, C and E Only
  • D.A, B and E Only
Correct Answer: A, B and E Only

Let’s examine each statement based on the Income Tax Act, 1961:

 

A. If a company is an Indian company, it will automatically be considered as a domestic company. ✔️

✅ True — Every Indian company is treated as a domestic company for tax purposes.

 

B. Foreign company means a company which is not a domestic company. ✔️

✅ True — A foreign company is one which is not a domestic company.

 

C. The residential status of an Indian company can be non-resident in India. ❌

False — An Indian company is always resident in India. It cannot be non-resident.

 

D. The residential status of a foreign company can never be resident in India. ❌

False — A foreign company can be treated as resident in India if its Place of Effective Management (POEM) is in India during the relevant previous year.

 

E. Foreign income is taxable in the hands of company resident in India. ✔️

✅ True — A resident company is taxed on its global income, including income earned abroad.

 

Thus, option (D) is correct.

Question 91
Match the LIST–I with LIST–II:(UGC NET Commerce June2025)LIST–IA. Deduction of Tax at source on fees for professional and technical servicesB. Deduction of Tax at source from income by way of rentC. Deduction of Tax at source from winnings from lotteries or crossword puzzles, etc.D. Deduction of Tax at source from interest on securitiesLIST–III. Section 194 BII. Section 193III. Section 194-IIV. Section 194 JChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.A–I, B–II, C–III, D–IV
  • B.A–IV, B–III, C–II, D–I
  • C.A–IV, B–III, C–I, D–II
  • D.A–II, B–I, C–IV, D–III
Correct Answer: A–IV, B–III, C–I, D–II

The correct match is as follows:

 

LIST–ILIST–II

A. TDS on fees for professional and technical servicesSection 194 J

B. TDS on income by way of rentSection 194-I

C. TDS on winnings from lotteries/ crossword puzzles, etc.Section 194B

D. TDS on interest on securitiesSection 193

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 92
Read the following passage and answer the questions: (UGC NET Commerce June2025)A mid-sized IT firm in India is facing multiple HR challenges as it expands. The company recently hired 200 employees but is struggling with high attrition, lack of structured training program and a weak performance appraisal system. Employees often feel over worked and underappreciated, leading to low engagement and motivation. The HR manager Priya wants to improve HR practices by implementing a structured performance appraisal system launching employee wellness program and using HR technology for recruitment. However shefaceresistance from senior management, who thinkthose initiativewill increase cost without direct financial benefits.Additionally, employee feedback indicates dissatisfaction with work life balance and unclear career progression. Some employees also feel that promotions are biased and that the company lack a proper succession plan.Priya is considering introducing flexible work arrangements, setting up leadership development program and adopting AI-driven HR analytics to improve decision making. However, she needs to convince top management of the long term benefits of these changes.Ques. Priya needs to address employee dissatisfaction with career progression. What should be her first step?
  • A.Encouraging employee to find new jobs
  • B.Reducing training budgets
  • C.Conducting skill gap analysis and creating career development plan
  • D.Promoting only senior employee
Correct Answer: Conducting skill gap analysis and creating career development plan

To address dissatisfaction with career progression, Priya should first identify employees’ current skills versus required skills. This helps design targeted career development plans and training paths, ensuring clarity and growth opportunities for employees.

 

Thus, the correct answer is option (C).

Question 93
Read the following passage and answer the questions: (UGC NET Commerce June2025)A mid-sized IT firm in India is facing multiple HR challenges as it expands. The company recently hired 200 employees but is struggling with high attrition, lack of structured training program and a weak performance appraisal system. Employees often feel over worked and underappreciated, leading to low engagement and motivation. The HR manager Priya wants to improve HR practices by implementing a structured performance appraisal system launching employee wellness program and using HR technology for recruitment. However shefaceresistance from senior management, who thinkthose initiativewill increase cost without direct financial benefits.Additionally, employee feedback indicates dissatisfaction with work life balance and unclear career progression. Some employees also feel that promotions are biased and that the company lack a proper succession plan.Priya is considering introducing flexible work arrangements, setting up leadership development program and adopting AI-driven HR analytics to improve decision making. However, she needs to convince top management of thelong termbenefits of these changes.Ques. Which strategy would be most effective in retaining employees and reducing attrition rate?
  • A.Making the resignation process more difficult
  • B.Increasing workload
  • C.Offering voluntary retirement
  • D.Offering increments and career growth opportunities
Correct Answer: Offering increments and career growth opportunities

Employees stay longer when they see chances for advancement and fair financial rewards. Competitive pay combined with career growth reduces attrition and boosts loyalty.

Question 94
Read the following passage and answer the questions: (UGC NET Commerce June2025)A mid-sized IT firm in India is facing multiple HR challenges as it expands. The company recently hired 200 employees but is struggling with high attrition, lack of structured training program and a weak performance appraisal system. Employees often feel over worked and underappreciated, leading to low engagement and motivation. The HR manager Priya wants to improve HR practices by implementing a structured performance appraisal system launching employee wellness program and using HR technology for recruitment. However shefaceresistance from senior management, who thinkthose initiativewill increase cost without direct financial benefits.Additionally, employee feedback indicates dissatisfaction with work life balance and unclear career progression. Some employees also feel that promotions are biased and that the company lack a proper succession plan.Priya is considering introducing flexible work arrangements, setting up leadership development program and adopting AI-driven HR analytics to improve decision making. However, she needs to convince top management of thelong termbenefits of these changes.Ques. To convince senior management about HR investments, Priya should highlight:
  • A.The number of training program conducted
  • B.The positive feedback of customers
  • C.The financial impact of HR initiatives on business growth
  • D.Theemployeesperformance appraisal methods
